website_summaries.verdict: This citronella candle is a beautiful conversation piece that will help keep bugs at bay creating a calm environment.
pros: Accented copper stand creates a rustic ambiance
All-natural beeswax can help diminish the effect of pollutants in the air
cons: Some owners challenge the claim that it will burn for 80 hours

customer_reviews.title: Deceptive advertising.
customer_reviews.text: Deceptive advertising. It says that the cancel burns about one inch every 20 minutes. It also says it burns for approximately 80 hours. Doing the math, that means the candle is over 200 inches in length. That means the winding candle wick would have to be over 6 yards long. It is not possible. It appears to be a lovely product, but it includes false claims regarding the number of hours the candle will burn.
customer_reviews.author: usaturk35

customer_reviews.title: Misleading product info.
customer_reviews.text: Measuring the burn time on this candle, @ two inches daily, resulted in only Seventy (70) Days, Not Eighty 80 as the manufacturer claims. Also, an inch of the candle will only burn for Nineteen (19) minutes, and two inches will burn for exactly Thirty-eight (38) minutes (+/- 20 seconds), Not an hour as the manufacturer claims! This was done inside a closed room @ 71°F/ 21.667°C. Final result = Total Burn Time is 2,660 minutes = 44.333 hours. NOT "80 hours" as claimed by the manufacturer! *I should only be paying Half the Price for what they have charged me.
customer_reviews.author: Jose A. Cervania

customer_reviews.title: Cool design.  Definitely NOT beeswax.
customer_reviews.text: These coil candles are a great idea, and I like the design of the holders. However, these candles are "made from beeswax", meaning that they may really only contain small amounts. Smells like petrol. I suspected something was off with the first coil sent with the holder. This replacement is the same. Made in Vietnam. Buyer beware.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: Hard to feed into the clip
customer_reviews.text: I love the idea of wrapping a super long candle around a spool like this. We've had it for around a year and use it a little each day and it's still going. However, during use the wax melts and runs down onto the clip, making it difficult to disengage. Also, the "spooled" part of the candle is hard to reposition into the clip, especially when it's "full" and very near the clip. You have to bend the wax back and forth as you push it into the clip. It has never broken on me, but it often feels like it's just about to. Overall I like it and would buy again.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect gift for the candle lover in your family
customer_reviews.text: My fiancée and I bought this as a gift for her sister, who loves candles just as much for decoration as she does for mellow mood-lighting. I don't know if she'll actually burn it, but knowing that she can buy more coils in the future definitely helps. I didn't pay attention to the actual dimensions while ordering so I was surprised at its size when it arrived. From the picture I was definitely expecting something big and heavy but instead this is more cute and light.

customer_reviews.title: Over all, quite pleased
customer_reviews.text: I very much enjoy this. I bought it as a gift for my wife. If I was to fault it, I would mention the continual trimming and adjusting. However for my family that has proved to be its main attraction. Similar to having a fireplace. When it is by choice, you generally enjoy all the fussing. Second would be the lack of scent beeswax candles are known for. My wife suggests that maybe the process to get the wax flexible is at fault. If so, it is worth the trade off. I suggest getting the refill at the same time so you don't have to be so conservative you lose enjoyment.
